posts.html:
"Turning and turning in the widening gyre
The falcon cannot hear the falconer;
Things fall apart; the centre cannot hold;
Mere anarchy is loosed upon the world,
The blood-dimmed tide is loosed, and everywhere
The ceremony of innocence is drowned;
The best lack all conviction, while the worst
Are full of p***ionate intensity."
~William B. Yeats, "The Second Coming"

I don't know if the nod to gyres was intentional, Wizards, but I love it.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: DoctorKenneth (4/16/2010 9:39:01 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This guy is seriously underrated. Kozilek is a more efficient fighter, but if you attack with anything that can kill a player in 2 hits and makes them sacrifice 4 or more permanents, it doesn't really matter how strong it is. On the other hand, this guy is indestructible and can destroy key threats when he comes into play. He's also immune to card disadvantage, because even if he's countered without spending a card, there's no way around his [Vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindicate) ability.  
  
I would call him better than Kozilek, and unless Eldrazi only see play by cheating, I think Emrakul's cost is prohibitive enough that Ulamog is better than it as well. Plus, it's predictable. If you ramp yourself past 12 and don't cast anything, they pretty much know exactly what you're planning.
posts.html:

On the other hand, this guy is indestructible and can destroy key threats when he comes into play. He's also immune to card disadvantage, because even if he's countered without spending a card, there's no way around his Vindicate ability.

I would call him better than Kozilek, and unless Eldrazi only see play by cheating, I think Emrakul's cost is prohibitive enough that Ulamog is better than it as well. Plus, it's predictable. If you ramp yourself past 12 and don't cast anything, they pretty much know exactly what you're planning.

Posted By: SleetFox (4/16/2010 9:31:08 PM)

posts.post_content: I think you guys are underestimating this guy. Sure, the other Eldrazi are probably better, but this card is still great. Basically a Darksteel Colossus with -1/-1 and no trample (probably around 9 CMC), a [Vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindicate) tacked on (3 CMC), and Annihilator 4, which SHOULD probably tack on another 3 mana in my opinion. This adds up to 15 mana, yet it only costs 11. If the other Eldrazi weren't in the picture, I can definitely see this getting up to the 4.5 range in ratings, just like Mr. Colossus over there.

Posted By: Zulp (4/16/2010 8:00:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Hands down one of the best Eldrazi.  
  
His "destroy target permanent" is what makes this so good. What good is a fatty eldrazi if there's a [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor) ready to bounce it back to your hand or even a 3-mana [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk) to keep your big guy from turning sideways.  
  
This Eldrazi covers its own behind in taking out the one threat on the other side of the board that can give you problems.  
  
5/5

Posted By: BattleMagnum (4/24/2010 11:41:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn) seems to be a safer bet than Ulamog, since Em over there has protection from Colored Spells. That means it cannot be exiled by swords, Path, O-rings etc. and cannot be countered. sure, this guy costs 11 for a 10/10 Eldrazi, which is probably cheaper than the others, and is indestructible, and also can do shnitz when it comes into play, but it can still be [Unmake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unmake)d exiled and so on. Although I do agree, it should not be frowned upon, every card has its up and its downs, like how Em can still be killed by Wrath, but which isn't??? (rhetorical question.)  
  
4.5/5 but not overall the best

Posted By: Hibron (4/23/2010 8:18:51 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ongck : Ulamog looks like it's flexing its muscles in a victory stance after having killed an opposing Emrakul :P  
  
This card is really awesome, but I don't think you need me to tell you that. Apart from being enormous like the other 2 Eldrazi progenitors, his indestructibility really helps him deal with large threats (and renders him immune to [Smite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Smite)), and the [Vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindicate) ability allows him to quickly take down immediate threats, meaning you won't have to attack with him and wait for his annihalator ability to take care of things. Actually, one of the best things about him *is* probably his [Vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindicate) ability, since it allows him to actually deal with [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn).
posts.html:
@ongck : Ulamog looks like it's flexing its muscles in a victory stance after having killed an opposing Emrakul :P

This card is really awesome, but I don't think you need me to tell you that. Apart from being enormous like the other 2 Eldrazi progenitors, his indestructibility really helps him deal with large threats (and renders him immune to Smite), and the Vindicate ability allows him to quickly take down immediate threats, meaning you won't have to attack with him and wait for his annihalator ability to take care of things. Actually, one of the best things about him is probably his Vindicate ability, since it allows him to actually deal with Emrakul, the Aeons Torn.

posts.post_content:
This creature imo is better than the other 2 eldrazi titans. Emrakul is awesome, but its 15 mana, and there are ways around colored protection. Kozilek is interesting, but maybe no more so than some of the other eldrazi.
  
   
Ulamog on the other hand.. is indestructible, efficiently costed for an eldrazi, and has a built in destroy while still making mill useless. Just awesome. If I had to choose I'd go with ulamog for sure.
